title: The Voice's future still undecided as BBC rules out 'a bidding war'
text:
The Voice's future still undecided as BBC rules out 'a bidding war' The Voice's future still undecided as BBC rules out 'a bidding war' Share 
The BBC will not enter into “a bidding war” for singing talent series The Voice. 
Following speculation and headlines concerning prospects for the popular show, a BBC source said: “It is incorrect to say the BBC has axed The Voice. We are in discussions about its future, but we won’t get into a bidding war.” 
The source added: “We have made a final bid that we won’t increase. We love the show but we won’t pay inflated prices to keep hold of it. We have made a final two-year bid, and now it is out of our hands.” 
In the UK, The Voice is produced by Wall to Wall, alongside Talpa Media, the Dutch-based production company behind the format. The series was created by John de Mol. (Wall To Wall/BBC) 
However, ITV acquired Talpa Media in a deal worth approximately £355 million. 
The BBC source continued: “There seems to be some confusion as to who out of the three will decide, which is why some earlier reports have been conflicting.” 
This statement follows suggestions the BBC were not looking to renew the show’s contract over its £55 million cost. Share article 
The Voice is currently filming with an all-new panel featuring Paloma Faith, Will.i.am, Boy George and Ricky Wilson, with former coach Rita Ora having moved to ITV’s The X Factor. Promoted Stories
